meanings.definition: The act of spreading unverified information or gossip.
meanings.sent1: Her constant rumouring about others caused a lot of drama in the office.
meanings.sent2: The rumouring in the school hallways made it hard to know what was true.
meanings.sent3: The rumouring at the party was so exaggerated that it became a game of telephone.
meanings.sent4: The rumouring in the small town spread faster than wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The rumouring about the new student was like a whirlwind of stories.

meanings.sent1: She was rumouring about a possible promotion at work.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends enjoyed rumouring about celebrities.
meanings.sent3: He was rumouring so much that he started to believe his own lies.
meanings.sent4: The politician was rumouring to gain an advantage in the election.
meanings.sent5: The kids were rumouring about a secret treasure hidden in the park.
